      boolean createAOCContainer​(byte secretType, byte[] secret, short secretOffset, short secretLen, short maxRetry, byte[] name, short appNameOffset, short appNameLen, byte[] expireTS, short expOffset)
      Creates an Applet Object Container (AOC).
      short cryptoChaCha20​(byte[] key, short keyOffset, byte[] nonce, short nonceOffset, byte[] counter, short ctrOffset, byte[] input, short inOffset, short length, byte[] output, short outOffset)
      Cryptographic assistant function for one-shot ChaCha256 calculation.
      short cryptoHMAC​(byte hashType, byte[] key, short keyOffset, short keyLength, byte[] msg, short mOff, short mLen, byte[] ipad, short offIPad, byte[] opad, short offOPad, byte[] secB, short offSecB, byte[] oMsg, short outOff)
      Cryptographic assistant function for one-shot HMAC calculation.
      boolean destroyAOCContainer()
      Destroys AOC container.
      short extendedRequest​(byte[] input, short offset, short len, byte[] output, short outOffset)
      Extending request of an AUTH_INTERNAL authenticated call to a function requiring authentication.
      boolean finalizeNewContainer​(byte[] output, short outOffset)
      Finalize a newly created Applet Object Container.
      short getAOCInfo​(byte targetProfileFieldSearch, byte[] output, short outOffset)
      Get AOC public information.
      boolean getTime​(byte[] output, short offset)
      Get the current system time from the T101's internal RTC clock.
      short hexStrToBin​(byte[] input, short offset, byte[] output, short outOffset, short len)
      Convenience function to covert hexadecimal string representation to its binary equivalent.
      boolean isSessionBusy()
      Checks if the session is busy in the Key Manager.
      boolean manageAOCContainer​(byte fieldType, byte[] input, short offset, short len, byte[] output, short outOffset)
      Manages AOC container.
      short resetMainMenuSession​(byte[] output, short outOffset)
      Sets the KeyManager applet as the Main Menu applet.
      void resetSession()
      Resets a busy session by a registered applet.
      short setMainMenuSession​(byte[] output, short outOffset)
      Sets the current AOC registered applet as the Main Menu applet.

      Executes a GUI Session.

    • Method Detail

      • createAOCContainer

        boolean createAOCContainer​(byte secretType,
                           byte[] secret,
                           short secretOffset,
                           short secretLen,
                           short maxRetry,
                           byte[] name,
                           short appNameOffset,
                           short appNameLen,
                           byte[] expireTS,
                           short expOffset)
        Creates an Applet Object Container (AOC).
        Parameters:
        secretType - the secret type to be used for digital signing challenge-response protocol between the KeyManager and client applet.
        secret - the buffer containing the secret data used for digital signing challenge-response protocol between the KeyManager and client applet.
        secretOffset - the offset within secret to start.
        secretLen - the length of the secret data.
        maxRetry - the maximum consecutive invalid challenge-response authentication counts before the AOC container becomes locked.
        name - the buffer containing the AOC container's unique application name.
        appNameOffset - the offset within name to start.
        appNameLen - the length of the AOC container's unique application name.
        expireTS - the buffer containing the expiry timestamp of the AOC container.
        expOffset - the offset within the expireTS to start.
        Returns:
        true if the creation of an AOC container has been successfully called.

      • finalizeNewContainer

        boolean finalizeNewContainer​(byte[] output,
                             short outOffset)
        Finalize a newly created Applet Object Container.
        Parameters:
        output - containing the 8-byte challenge for the applet's AOC PIN/Key to sign using HMAC-SHA256 algorithm for this activity.
        outOffset - offset within output to start.
        Returns:
        true if an AOC container creation has successfully been created, initialized and made ready.

      • destroyAOCContainer

        boolean destroyAOCContainer()
        Destroys AOC container.

        The caller must be the AOC container owning applet.
        Returns:
        true if an AOC container has successfully been destroyed.

      • manageAOCContainer

        boolean manageAOCContainer​(byte fieldType,
                           byte[] input,
                           short offset,
                           short len,
                           byte[] output,
                           short outOffset)
        Manages AOC container.

        The caller must be the AOC container owning applet.
        Parameters:
        fieldType - the field type to edit and manage for the AOC container.
        input - the input data for managing the AOC container.
        offset - the offset within input to start.
        len - the length of input data for managing the AOC container.
        output - containing the 8-byte challenge for the applet's AOC PIN/Key to sign using HMAC-SHA256 algorithm for this activity.
        outOffset - offset within output to start.
        Returns:
        true if an AOC conrainer management function has been successfully performed.

      • getAOCInfo

        short getAOCInfo​(byte targetProfileFieldSearch,
                 byte[] output,
                 short outOffset)
        Get AOC public information.

        The caller must be the AOC container owning applet.
        Parameters:
        targetProfileFieldSearch - the field type to search for public AOC information.
        output - containing the returned result of the AOC container enquiry.
        outOffset - offset within output to start.
        Returns:
        the length of result returned in the output buffer.

      • extendedRequest

        short extendedRequest​(byte[] input,
                      short offset,
                      short len,
                      byte[] output,
                      short outOffset)
        Extending request of an AUTH_INTERNAL authenticated call to a function requiring authentication.

        The caller must be the AOC container owning applet.

        The extendedRequest command is to be called subsequenyl after the following API commands are called first:
        • finalizeNewContainer
        • manageAOCContainer
        • uiSession
        • setMainMenuSession
        • resetMainMenuSession


        Output results for finalizeNewContainer, manageAOCContainer, setMainMenuSession and resetMainMenuSession methods
        Output Length Output Parameter Description
        1 (Success) Content has no significance.
        0 (Fail) Content has no significance.
        -1 (Authentication Failure) Content has no significance. It may reflect an invalid Session Status where the current executing job is not assigned to your applet or your applet is not registered as an AOC applet.


        Output results for uiSession different UI types
        UI Type Output Length Output Parameter Description
        Text Display Window 0 (C button pressed)
        1 (OK button pressed)
        2 (Timeout without key input)
        -1 (Invalid parameters. It may reflect an invalid Session Status where the current executing job is not assigned to your applet or your applet is not registered as an AOC applet.)        		 Content has no significance.
        QR Code Display Window 0 (C button pressed)
        1 (OK button pressed)
        2 (Timeout without key input)
        -1 (Invalid parameters. It may reflect an invalid Session Status where the current executing job is not assigned to your applet or your applet is not registered as an AOC applet.)        		 Content has no significance.
        Input Entry Display Window >= 0 && <= uiSubMode4 specified max input length.
        -1 (Invalid parameters. It may reflect an invalid Session Status where the current executing job is not assigned to your applet or your applet is not registered as an AOC applet.)        		 Output contains the ASCII formatted text output that the user have keyed into the Input Entry keypad window.
        List Selection Display Window 2 (Length of list selected item result)
        -1 (Invalid parameters. It may reflect an invalid Session Status where the current executing job is not assigned to your applet or your applet is not registered as an AOC applet.)        		 First byte represents the type of selection status. The second byte represents the item index of the selected item.

        First byte item selection status
        Selection Status Selection Description
        (byte) 0x00Activity Timeout. Nothing selected.
        (byte) 0x01Item selected. Selected item index is in the second byte. Index 0 (1st item) to 5 (6th item)
        (byte) 0x02Activity Cancelled. Nothing selected.


        Parameters:
        input - the input buffer containing the digital signature response using HMAC-SHA256 on the 8-byte activity challenge.
        offset - offset within input to start.
        len - length of the digital signature response data.
        output - the output buffer containing the returned response from the executing target activity.
        outOffset - offset within outOffset to start.
        Returns:
        the lenght of returned response in the output buffer.

      • cryptoChaCha20

        short cryptoChaCha20​(byte[] key,
                     short keyOffset,
                     byte[] nonce,
                     short nonceOffset,
                     byte[] counter,
                     short ctrOffset,
                     byte[] input,
                     short inOffset,
                     short length,
                     byte[] output,
                     short outOffset)
        Cryptographic assistant function for one-shot ChaCha256 calculation. KeyManager does not store any data after this method has completed.

        Any applet with access to the T101OpenAPI may utilize this function without authentication required.

        End user may implement their own ChaCha256 function or use this ChaCha256 crypto-assistant function for cryptographic operations and are advised to actively zeroize the buffers after each use.
        Parameters:
        key - the buffer containing the ChaCha256 key.
        keyOffset - the offset within key to start.
        nonce - the buffer containing the ChaCha256 nonce.
        nonceOffset - the offset within ChaCha256 to start.
        counter - the buffer containing the ChaCha256 counter.
        ctrOffset - the offset within counter to start.
        input - the buffer containing the plaintext or ciphertext for ChaCha256 function to process.
        inOffset - the offset within input to start.
        length - the length of the input buffer data.
        output - the output buffer containing the returned response from the ChaCha256 function.
        outOffset - the offset within output to start.
        Returns:
        the length of returned result in the output buffer.

      • cryptoHMAC

        short cryptoHMAC​(byte hashType,
                 byte[] key,
                 short keyOffset,
                 short keyLength,
                 byte[] msg,
                 short mOff,
                 short mLen,
                 byte[] ipad,
                 short offIPad,
                 byte[] opad,
                 short offOPad,
                 byte[] secB,
                 short offSecB,
                 byte[] oMsg,
                 short outOff)
        Cryptographic assistant function for one-shot HMAC calculation. KeyManager does not store any data after this method has completed.

        Any applet with access to the T101OpenAPI may utilize this function without authentication required.

        End user may implement their own HMAC function or use this HMAC crypto-assistant function for cryptographic operations and are advised to actively zeroize the buffers after each use.
        Parameters:
        hashType - the MessageDigest hash type for HMAC function.
        key - the buffer containing the HMAC key data.
        keyOffset - the offset within key to start.
        keyLength - the length of the HMAC key data.
        msg - the buffer containing the data for HMAC computation.
        mOff - the offset within msg to start.
        mLen - the length of the msg data.
        ipad - the ipad buffer for computation.
        offIPad - the offset within ipad to start.
        opad - the opad buffer for computation.
        offOPad - the offset within opad to start.
        secB - the intermediate computation buffer.
        offSecB - the offset within secB to start.
        oMsg - the output buffer containing the returned response from the HMAC function.
        outOff - the offset within oMsg to start.
        Returns:
        the length of returned result in the output buffer.

      • uiSession

        short uiSession​(byte uiType,
                byte uiSubMode,
                byte uiSubMode1,
                byte uiSubMode2,
                byte uiSubMode3,
                byte uiSubMode4,
                byte[] title,
                short titleOffset,
                short titleLen,
                byte[] input,
                short inOffset,
                short inLen,
                byte[] output,
                short outOffset)
        Executes a GUI Session.

        The caller must be the AOC container owning applet.

        The following steps should be taken when trying to render a GUI session using uiSession() method.
        1. Call the uiSession() with appropriate parameters. An 8-byte challenge will be used in the output buffer.
        2. Calling applet will be required to use the aocPIN to sign via HMAC-SHA256 the 8-byte challenge.
        3. Calling applet will call the extendedRequest() method while setting the HMAC signature as the input buffer.
        4. The output buffer in the extendedRequest() will return the result of executing the uiSession() call.

        GUI window types and parameters
        UI Type Constants Description uiSubMode uiSubMode1 uiSubMode2 uiSubMode3 uiSubMode4
        Text Display Window T101OpenAPI.UI_TYPE_TEXT / (byte) 0x02 Displays a text message and listens for a button press (OK / C). Only ASCII formatted text messages maybe displayed. Binary hexadecimals must be converted to ASCII formats before displaying. N/A. N/A. N/A. N/A. N/A.
        QR Code Display Window T101OpenAPI.UI_TYPE_QR / (byte) 0x03 Displays a QR code message and listens for a button press (OK / C). ASCII formatted text messages or binary messages maybe displayed. N/A. N/A. N/A. N/A. N/A.
        Input Entry Display Window T101OpenAPI.UI_TYPE_INPUT / (byte) 0x04 Displays an input dialog window to receive a plaintext or secret input. Secret input are obfuscated with '*' character.
        Supported Keypad Modes
        Keypad Mode Constants Description
        Capitalized alphabet keypad T101OpenAPI.FLAG_VKEY_KEYPAD_CAPS_ALPHA / 0x01 Displays a capitalized alpahbet keypad for input.
        Small alphabet keypad T101OpenAPI.FLAG_VKEY_KEYPAD_LOWR_ALPHA / 0x02 Displays a small letter alpahbet keypad for input.
        Numeric keypad / PINpad T101OpenAPI.FLAG_VKEY_KEYPAD_NUMERIC_ALPHA / 0x04 Displays a numerical keypad for input.
        Printable ASCII symbols keypad T101OpenAPI.FLAG_VKEY_KEYPAD_SPECIAL / 0x08 Displays a printable ASCII symbols keypad for input.

        		Starting keypad mode.

        The first keypad mode to render.        		 Loaded keypads flags.

        Perform XOR on all keypads that will be loaded for this GUI Session window.

        Example for a ASCII letters only keypad with both captials and small letters enabled (uiSubMode1 = T101OpenAPI.FLAG_VKEY_KEYPAD_CAPS_ALPHA ^ T101OpenAPI.FLAG_VKEY_KEYPAD_LOWR_ALPHA)         		Is Secret Input flag (0xFF - true) If the input field has more than 0 bytes of input, the maximum input length is <= 16, else maximum input length <= 32. If the input field has more than 0 bytes of input, the minimum input length is <= 16, else minimum input length <= 32.
        List Selection Display Window T101OpenAPI.UI_TYPE_LIST / (byte) 0x05 Displays a list of items in a continously looping list or a non-looping list. Loop flag (0xFF - true, 0x00 - false) Item count flag representing the total amount of items to display N/A. N/A. N/A.


        Input types for different UI types
        UI Type Input Parameter Description Minimum Length Maximum Length
        Text Display Window Only ASCII formatted text. 0 128
        QR Code Display Window ASCII formatted text messages or binary messages. 0 128
        Input Entry Display Window Input used in the Input Entry Display Window provides an additional hint to the end user on the context for input entry. If a hint is set, the input entry will be reduced from 32 bytes to 16 bytes input can be accepted. 0 16
        List Selection Display Window Displays a list of items in a continously looping list or a non-looping list.

        Only ASCII formatted text maybe display as list items.

        A length-value array (binary length followed by ASCII content) is used to represent a list of items with each item having a length of <= 15 bytes.

        Example of the following hexadecimal string "0b68656c6c6f20776f726c640961636d6520636f72700b74686574616b6579313031" will render:
        ► hello world
           acme corp
           thetakey101
        The list selection cursor (►) will always select the first item in the list.         		1 96

        Parameters:
        uiType - the type of UI Session to call.
        uiSubMode - refer to UI Session subModes table above.
        uiSubMode1 - refer to UI Session subModes table above.
        uiSubMode2 - refer to UI Session subModes table above.
        uiSubMode3 - refer to UI Session subModes table above.
        uiSubMode4 - refer to UI Session subModes table above.
        title - the title to display on the UI Session title bar.
        titleOffset - the offset within title to start.
        titleLen - the length of the title to display.
        input - the input data for the UI Session.
        inOffset - the offset within input to start.
        inLen - the length of the input data for the UI Session.
        output - containing the 8-byte challenge for the applet's AOC PIN/Key to sign using HMAC-SHA256 algorithm for this activity.
        outOffset - offset within output to start.
        Returns:
        the length of returned result in the output buffer.

      • getTime

        boolean getTime​(byte[] output,
                short offset)
        Get the current system time from the T101's internal RTC clock.

        A 4 byte hexadecimal representation of the current UNIX timestamp will be given.
        Parameters:
        output - containing the hexadecimal representation of the current RTC clock time.
        offset - offset within output to start.
        Returns:
        true if getTime fetches the current internal RTC clock time successfully.

      • isSessionBusy

        boolean isSessionBusy()
        Checks if the session is busy in the Key Manager.
        Returns:
        true if the current KeyManager session is busy.

      • resetSession

        void resetSession()
        Resets a busy session by a registered applet. The currently running session and its internal states will be reset and yield no results.

        This function should only be used to break a deadlocked KeyManager session and be used with utmost care.

      • setMainMenuSession

        short setMainMenuSession​(byte[] output,
                         short outOffset)
        Sets the current AOC registered applet as the Main Menu applet. After this method is called, a physical reboot of the T101 via the power button is needed.

        An extendedRequest call needs to be followed up with the digital signature computed from the 8-byte challenge found in the output of this activity call for activity authentication purposes.
        Parameters:
        output - containing the 8-byte challenge for the applet's AOC PIN/Key to sign using HMAC-SHA256 algorithm for this activity.
        outOffset - offset within output to start.
        Returns:
        the length of returned result in the output buffer.

      • resetMainMenuSession

        short resetMainMenuSession​(byte[] output,
                           short outOffset)
        Sets the KeyManager applet as the Main Menu applet. Physically rebooting the T101 via the power button is needed.

        Developers are encouraged to implement this method to reset the KeyManager back to the default Main Menu for convenience of other applets.

        An extendedRequest call needs to be followed up with the digital signature computed from the 8-byte challenge found in the output of this activity call for activity authentication purposes.
        Parameters:
        output - containing the 8-byte challenge for the applet's AOC PIN/Key to sign using HMAC-SHA256 algorithm for this activity.
        outOffset - offset within output to start.
        Returns:
        the length of returned result in the output buffer or an output status.

      • hexStrToBin

        short hexStrToBin​(byte[] input,
                  short offset,
                  byte[] output,
                  short outOffset,
                  short len)
        Convenience function to covert hexadecimal string representation to its binary equivalent. An example is a hexstring representation "AABBCCDDEEFF" to binary form of 0xAABBCCDDEEFF.
        Parameters:
        input - the input buffer containing the hexadecimal string input for encoding.
        offset - the offset within input to start.
        output - the output buffer containing the binary format derived from the hexadecimal string input.
        outOffset - the offset within output to start.
        len - the length of the input to be encoded.
        Returns:
        the length of returned result in the output buffer.
